intro: Canthium rhamnifolium, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by follicle fruits that contain seeds with silky hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
